p: The naming convention for each file is AIM-SSPRCP-Emissions_$[socioeconomic assumption]_$[climate mitigation level]_$[species]_$[version]. The elements in each of the three dimensions are listed in Table 5. For example, the BC emissions in SSP1 under a 2.6 Wm −2 climate mitigation level are stored in the file named “SSP1-26-BCE.nc”. Moreover, emissions are differentiated by source sector, as shown in Table 4, which are named as listed in Table 6. All data are represented as the mean (kg/m 2/s). Zero values are represented as “NaN”. The full list of file names and their corresponding species and scenarios are shown in Supplementary Table S2.
